column3: BRENDA Tissue and Enzyme Source Ontology

column2: Genome-wide analysis of H3K27me3 in Brassica rapa
Study of the genome-wide levels of H3K27me3 in leaves and inflorescences of B. rapa R-o-18, an oilseed variety, and its correlation with transcriptional activity of the marked genes.

column2: Chip-Seq of H3K27me3 sites in Brassica leaves versus inflorescences

ChIP experiments were performed using B. rapa R-o-18 wild-type primary leaves collected 14 days after germination. ChIP-seq sequencing libraries were prepared using NEBNext Ultra DNA Library Prep kit (New England BioLabs 7370) starting from 4 ng of immunoprecipitated DNA. One inflorescence and two leaves ChIP-seq biological replicates were sequenced at 2x125 bp paired-end reads in an Illumina HiSeq 2500 platform using the SBS v4 kit (Illumina)

column2: RNASeq of gene expression in Brassica leaves versus inflorescences

Total RNA was extracted from plant tissues using EZNA Plant RNA Kit (Omega Bio-tek). Complementary DNA (cDNA) was prepared by reverse transcription of 1 µg of total RNA using “Maxima cDNA Kit with dsDNase”. Quantification was performed by RT-qPCR using the LightCycler 480 and SYBR Green I Master mix (Roche). Gene expression was determined by 2-ΔΔCT method using BraA.TUBULIN (BraA10g026070.3C) [47] as housekeeping gene.
